**Theorem 4 (Convergence of SMAC)**

In the limit where the time allowed for configuration search approaches infinity, SMAC optimizes a cost measure c based on a consistent estimator \(\hat{c}_N\) and a finite configuration space Θ. Specifically, the probability that it identifies the true optimal parameter configuration θ∗ ∈ Θ converges to one.

**Proof**

Each iteration of SMBO takes finite time, implying that as time approaches infinity so does the number of SMBO iterations, J. By Lemma 3, as J increases without bound, N(θ) grows unbounded for each θ ∈ Θ. As N(θ1) and N(θ2) approach infinity, pairwise comparisons according to Lemma 2 ensure that the truly better configuration is preferred. Consequently, SMAC eventually visits all finitely many parameter configurations and selects the best one with a probability arbitrarily close to one.

Note: This modified version maintains the original meaning while minor adjustments were made for clarity and consistency in terminology.
